intro: Tithymalus firmus, commonly known as the rigid tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a peppery scent when crushed. Tithymalus firmus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
